title: How does imperialism affect culture? - Quora

response.answer_text: How culture is affected by imperialism depends two general factors. First is the factor of the policies the imperialist metropolitan power imposes on the subordination or dependent communities. Second is the subordinate community’s reception of the policies imposed by the metropolis. Imperial powers exercised by Greece and Rome were often relatively laissez faire with regard to local cultures of conquered territories. As long as Greek or Roman edicts were being apparently observed, local culture was allowed relatively free reign. However, modern imperialism may operate more through cultural domination than conquest wherein the metropolis may or may not be consciously attempting to dominate subordinate cultures but ends up doing so through the acceptance of technological and cultural artifacts exported from the metropolis to the dependencies.
